Description: Fragment of wool, weft-faced plain weave textile, mainly plain cream or yellow, leaf-shaped tapestry (single warp threads) motif in red and dark blue; Double row of twining; Warp: S spun, c.10 tpc; Weft: S spun, c.32 tpc in plain areas, c.45 in tapestry; Edges: one selvedge with fringe (loops apparently on both sides), others ragged
Curator's comments: Presence of twining makes it unlikely that is is a lower corner of a tunic; Previous location cupboard 64, blue box; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (8.11.1989)
Condition: Fragmentary and discoloured; Unknown date stuck to sticky net
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
